title: 820-00840 water damage dead.
message:
"there is no  PM_EN_P3V3S5 on board"
I considered a technician can make an equivalence between schematic and boardview; but not such afirmation!!!
Seems that you've never checked the expected signal, when I asked for.
So again, what is PM_EN_P3V3S5 level???
I'm sure pin 1/R7662, or pin 5/U7890 cannot have another function on YOUR board.

BTW, I didn't ask for a screenshot of R7662.
Just mentioned to change it, because of your misunderstood; cannot have 0V and 3V on two pins of a 0 ohm resistor.
No idea that you didn't even check at pin1...

title: 820-00840 water damage dead.
message:
If SMC receives high level on S5_PWRGD, it must send out 3V at PM_DSW_PWRGD.
If not, bad SMC, or PCH.
There could be bad solder under SMC too.

title: 820-00840 water damage dead.
message:
PCH will NOT start power on sequence until gets high level on PM_DSW_PWRGD.
If 3V3_S5 is present, SMC must receives S5_PWRGD and releases PM_DSW_PWRGD.
